item.title: Cheatsheet for Python Data Analysis
item.author: runqiyang@gmail.com (Runqi Yang)
item.description: It’s not just another cheatsheet. Here are most frequent and important methods in a machine learning project with CAUTIONS and TIPS. Some other useful tools, like bcolz and Jupyter notebook widgets, are also covered.

item.title: Machine Learing
item.author: runqiyang@gmail.com (Runqi Yang)
item.description: This post aims to share a list of notes (compiled by myself) on some important machine learning topics. Most of the concepts are mathematical, but after all, math is the most precise language!

item.author: runqiyang@gmail.com (Runqi Yang)
item.description: Runqi Yang (杨润琦) NLP Engineer in Alime X Lab Alibaba Group hitvoice runqiyang@gmail.com Biography I'm a NLP engineer @Alibaba. I received my M.Sc. degree in Computer Science in 2019 and B.Sc. degree in Electronic Engineering in 2016, both from Nanjing University. Publications (ACL19) Simple and Effective Text Matching with Richer Alignment Features (1st author, pdf | github) (AAAI18) Multi-Entity Aspect-Based Sentiment Analysis with Context, Entity and Aspect Memory (2nd author, link | pdf | code and data) Contributions to Open Source Projects my repository, implementation of DrQA (300+ stars, on DWANBench leaderboard) pytorch/pytorch: bug reporting #1687 #3789 pytorch/fairseq: pull request #134 facebookresearch/ParlAI: pull request #176 AIChallenger/AI_Challenger: pull request #16#19#25 my GithubGist Articles and Talks 2018, Introduction to Text Generation (slides) 2017, interview with Zhihu machine learning team, Machine Learning Theory and Practice (in Chinese) (link) 2017, Introduction to Machine Reading Comprehension (slides) 2017, interview with iFLYTEK Research, Attention-over-Attention: A Way Towards Machine Reading Comprehension (in Chinese) (link) 2016, Pracical Advice on Machine Learning Projects (slides) Awards and Honors 2017, The Outstanding Camper Award at DeeCamp, Sinovation Ventures 2013, Outstanding Student of Nanjing University Miscellaneous My name pronounces as "Ren-Chee" (sounding like "rent" and "cheese" without "t" and "se") I love guitar, musical, drama and paiting.
